intro: Combretum nusbaumeri, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking, fiery orange to red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for cultivation in warm climates. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant floral display and ability to provide shade in landscaped areas.
